thread.title: Arsenal fan group confirms Alexis dogs banner
thread.title_full: Arsenal fan group confirms Alexis dogs banner

title: Arsenal fan group confirms Alexis dogs banner
text:
Arsenal fan group confirms Alexis dogs banner Getty 0 11 Jan 2017 23:15:09 Alexis is out of contract next summer and Arsenal fans have shown their love for the star by dedicating a banner to his beloved canines 
An Arsenal fan group has confirmed that they will unfurl a banner of Alexis Sanchez and his two dogs for the next home game at Emirates Stadium. 
Alexis, 27, regularly posts posts of himself together with his two golden retrievers Atom and Humber, prompting one fan to suggest that the fans should host a banner for the dogs. We need an Atom and Humber banner at the Emirates. Alexis will stay for life. His dogs are his life. Respect them and he will respect you. 
Liverpool stink up St. Mary's 
Twitter user @aliladiere explained to Goal how the idea came about after seeing a photo of the dogs on Sanchez’s Instagram account. 
"It was just a tweet I thought of as I was looking at Alexis' Instagram. It's just a bit of fun - then I get people agreeing with me and sending in photos!" 
"The real credit goes to the Arsenal fans for sharing it and to the RedAaction fan group. They're making it a reality, so let's hope he likes it” 
"I hope Alexis sees what he means to the club and our fans. We can have different opinions on many things but every Arsenal fan wants Alexis to stay” 
Sanchez has previously starred alongside his dogs for a Chilean dog food advert and Gunners fan group REDAction have revealed that plans are in place for two banners to makes their debut when Arsenal play Burnley on January 22. Confirmation of sizes - upper tier permanent banner : 1 metre x 6 metres pic.twitter.com/48e305RjzN — REDaction Gooners (@REDactionAFC) January 11, 2017 Club Level temporary banner: 2 metres x 9 metres pic.twitter.com/P0b3WLEAIY — REDaction Gooners (@REDactionAFC) January 11, 2017 Related
